A bit about me

I‚Äôve been a professional software engineer since 2021, and worn a few different hats in that time. I‚Äôve worked in T3 support doing about everything you can imagine in a massive platform that managed an insane amount of information. I‚Äôve lead a team through greenfield development on a project with loose guidelines and looser interpretations of done- and I‚Äôve taken on traditional software development, working on projects that have tied all my knowledge and experience together in ways I never imagined.

Lately, I‚Äôve found that I have a lot of room to grow. Through all these experiences, I‚Äôve picked up a lot- but there are a thousand solutions to every problem, and I‚Äôve only seen a few solutions so far. All this has made me realize that I‚Äôm at my best when I‚Äôm actively learning and building new things. I want to try to solve problems, then learn about how others have solved them to gather even better insights. I want to build things that someone might actually use, even if I‚Äôm the only ‚Äúsomeone.‚Äù It feels more valuable to build something and fail than it does to dream about building something and never even start.

Besides coding, I collect hobbies like trading cards. I have loved Magic for years, been gaming for as long as I can remember, tinkering on computers since kindergarten, and more recently picked up fishing, hiking, camping, and, of course, knitting and crochet (it‚Äôs just so zen!). I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôll find something new soon, and add it to the stack of things I would love to do if I only had more time üòâ For now, I‚Äôm trying to focus on getting some projects off the ground and actually deployed- and that should keep me pretty busy for the next 6 months at least!

entry.title: DeckRND
entry.content:
DeckRND

DeckRND is a one-stop shop for all your deck building shemes! Buy and sell cards at the Bazaar, track and optimize your deck on the Workbench, and keep tabs on your entire collection at a glance in the Vault.

This project is currently in the planning and early development phase. Be sure to follow for updates as they come out!

entry.title: harmonee
entry.content:
(Family) harmonee

Keeping all the details together in a family is a tricky business- everybody has their own schedules, needs, preferences, and ideas, and things can easily get chaotic! Bring all these into harmonee, a private place to communicate, plan, and prepare for all the extra notes life throws our way. Your family can use harmonee to:

  • Make meals easier:
    • Easy filters to find the right recipe for each meal
    • Plan meals a day, a week, or even a month in advance
    • Create a shopping list in a click from your meal plan
    • Share lists and recipes so they can add their favorites
    • Keep track of the ingredients you have on hand with the in-app pantry
    • Scan receipts to automatically add groceries, scan barcodes as you use items to remove them
  • See the due dates BEFORE they‚Äôre due:
    • Keep track of due dates, appointments, events, and schedules all in one place
    • Easily add a list, task, or even a whole project to any calendar item
    • Link your favorite calendar apps to share automatically
    • Make a suggestion, and let your family weigh in on your event ideas!
  • Work as a team:
    • Share lists, projects, ideas, and events with anybody you choose
    • Set up roles and permissions to make sure those surprise party plans don‚Äôt get revealed too early
    • Make requests that can be approved or denied by family guardians
  • We didn‚Äôt forget about the family who doesn‚Äôt live at home:
    • Connect households together with single use links right from the app
    • Share whatever you want with connected families
    • Create public spaces for all your clubs, groups, and hobbies

Harmonee is currently in early, active development. Keep watch here as things develop!
